alert.note: Alert for Eastern Interior; Northeast; Northwest (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 17 at 12:39AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, including the following areas, in Puerto Rico, Central Interior, Culebra, Eastern Interior, Mayaguez and Vicinity, North Central, Northeast, Northwest, Ponce and Vicinity, San Juan and Vicinity, Southeast, Southwest, Vieques, and Western Interior. In Virgin Islands, St Croix and St.Thomas...St. John...and Adjacent Islands. * WHEN...Tonight through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. The heaviest rainfall is currently forecast for Saturday through Monday. Highest rainfall amounts are anticipated across eastern, southeastern to southwestern Puerto Rico, where 8 to 10 inches is possible, with a chance for higher values locally. Significant rain and impacts are anticipated elsewhere, including: Northeastern and central Puerto Rico with rainfall totals of 6 to 8 inches, with locally higher values. In the U.S. Virgin Islands, between 4 and 6 inches of rain is forecast. Elsewhere, rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches are expected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
